snippet: Officials had said that electricity would return to many homes in a week or so. But even that forecast may have been optimistic.
abstract: New Yorkers whose homes lost electricity due to Hurricane Sandy may have to wait more than two weeks to get it back, and Consolidated Edison officials say that some homes, mainly those that are the only ones without power on a street, may have to wait until mid-November.
lead_paragraph: Officials had said that electricity would return to many homes in a week or so. But even that forecast may have been optimistic.

headline.seo: Power Restoration After Hurricane Sandy May Take Longer Than Expected
headline.main: Wait for Power May Linger for Some
headline.print_headline: In Areas, The Wait For Power May Linger
